column1: Table D2.09.4: First Nations population distribution, state and territory by socioeconomic area, and remoteness by socioeconomic area, based on Indigenous Relative Socioeconomic Outcomes (IRSEO) quintiles(a), 2021

(a) 2021 IRSEO index was published by the Australian National University: https://caepr.cass.anu.edu.au/research/publications/area-level-socioeconomic-outcomes-aboriginal-and-torres-strait-islander. For this analysis, the AIHW divided Indigenous Areas (IAREs) into quintiles based on the IRSEO score, each including 80 or 81 IAREs. IAREs without an IRSEO score are shown in the 'not applicable' category.
(b) Includes people in Other territories, those in migratory, offshore or shipping regions, and those with no usual address.
1. Cells in this table have been randomly adjusted to avoid the release of confidential data. These adjustments may cause the sum of rows or columns to differ by small amounts from table totals.
2. Data excludes Overseas Visitors and persons who did not state their Indigenous status.
3. IRSAD is the SEIFA Index of Relative Socio-Economic Advantage and Disadvantage. Quintiles are based on a national area-based index ranking of Statistical Area 1 (SA1) of Usual Residence.
Source: AIHW analysis of ABS Census of Population and Housing 2021 (ABS 2022).

ABS (Australian Bureau of Statistics) 2022. '2021 Census - counting persons, place of usual residence' [Census TableBuilder Pro product], accessed 25/05/2024, https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/microdata-tablebuilder/tablebuilder
